result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Troy Alan Schiller

records.addlTxt: Preliminary Hearing - Schedule or Waiver on November 16, 2022 at 09:00 am.
from ADA McConnell to Br 1

1:31 PM Defendant Troy Alan Schiller in court.  Attorney Reed Cornia in court for Troy Alan Schiller.  Prosecuting attorney Rick C Spoentgen in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Court does not order bond forfeiture since it was previously reinstated.  Atty Cornia advises they are trying to reach a global offer.  Atty Cornia advises there is a trial in 2 Br. 2 cases and there is a case in Br. 3 as well.  State suggests a TSC for all Br. 1 cases.  Atty Cornia enters not guilty plea.  Court enters not guilty plea(s).
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 16, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on November 16, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Prior: 715 12th Street #3, Baraboo, WI 53913
Notice of Bail/Bond Forfeiture Hearing

2:50 PM Prosecuting attorney Gabriel David Arevalo and intern Dan Moon in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Troy Alan Schiller appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Allison A Markoski appeared by video for Troy Alan Schiller.  Court states cases and parties state appearances.  Atty Markoski explains reason for DE being late for his RD yesterday and requests the cash bonds be reinstated.  State responds.  Court orders bonds.  All matters set to track.

20CM220 - $200 cash bond reinstated and RD set for 9/15 at 1pm

20CM134 - $200 cash bond reinstated and RD set for 9/15 at 1pm

 Based on non-appearance, court authorized warrants and orders cash bond forfeitures commence in any cases where bond has been posted.

01:08 PM Defendant Troy Alan Schiller in court with attorney Reed Cornia.  Natalia J Gess appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Cornia advises he has a conflict.  New counsel will be appointed.  Court resets matter.  Telephone scheduling conference scheduled for May 31, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Return date on April 29, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

03:52 PM Defendant Troy Alan Schiller in court with attorney Reed Cornia.  Defendant Troy Alan Schiller in custody.  Natalia J Gess appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court officer Nick Smith appears.  Back on record 4:02 PM.  Court addresses time limits with defendant again.  DE wants to have bond modification hearing.  Court tells DE the proper procedure(s) for that.  DE freely, voluntarily waives time limits for holding preliminary hearing to discuss case with atty.  Return date scheduled for April 29, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Preliminary hearing on March 24, 2022 at 10:30 am.

02:40 PM Defendant Troy Alan Schiller by Zoom audio and video from LEC with attorney Annie E Getsinger by Zoom audio and video.  Defendant Troy Alan Schiller in custody.  Gabriel David Arevalo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant received a copy of the Complaint but was unable to read it due to not having glasses but Atty Getsinger did explain the Complaint, charges and penalties to DE.  Court advises DE of charges/max penalties.  Advised of rights to an attorney.  Time limits NOT waived for preliminary hearing.  State recommends $2,000 cash bond.  Atty Getsinger recommends signature bond.  $500.00 CASH bond set.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 24, 2022 at 10:30 am.
